Overview.Definition: Jira is a project management tool developed by Atlassian for tracking issues, bugs, and project management.
Overview.Features: Supports Agile methodologies, customizable workflows, and integration with various tools.

Basic Concepts.Issue: A single work item that needs to be tracked, such as a task or bug.
Basic Concepts.Project: A collection of issues grouped together, representing a larger body of work.
Basic Concepts.Board: A visual representation of issues, typically used in Agile methodologies (Scrum or Kanban).

Creating a Project.Steps: 1. Click on 'Projects' > 'Create project'. 2. Choose a template. 3. Configure settings.

Creating an Issue.Steps: 1. Click on 'Create'. 2. Fill in the details (summary, description, type). 3. Click 'Create'.

Basic Navigation.Dashboard: A customizable view that displays important information about projects and issues.
Basic Navigation.Filters: Used to search and organize issues based on criteria.

Workflows.Definition: A series of steps that issues follow from creation to completion.

Customization.Steps: 1. Go to 'Jira settings' > 'Issues' > 'Workflows'. 2. Edit or create a new workflow.

Creating a Scrum Board.Steps: 1. Click on 'Boards' > 'Create board'. 2. Choose Scrum board and select project.

Creating a Kanban Board.Steps: 1. Click on 'Boards' > 'Create board'. 2. Choose Kanban board and select project.

Sprints.Definition: A time-boxed iteration of work in Agile.

Managing Sprints.Example: Start a sprint from the Scrum board by selecting 'Start Sprint'.

Custom Fields.Definition: Additional fields that can be added to issues to capture specific information.

Creating Custom Fields.Steps: 1. Go to 'Jira settings' > 'Issues' > 'Custom fields'. 2. Click 'Add custom field'.

Reporting.Overview: Generate reports to track project progress and team performance.

Types of Reports.Burn-down Chart: Tracks work completed versus planned work.
Types of Reports.Control Chart: Analyzes the flow of work over time.

Integrations.Overview: Connect Jira with other tools to enhance functionality.

Popular Integrations.Confluence: Documentation tool that integrates with Jira.

Permissions and Roles.Overview: Manage user access and roles within projects.

Configuring Permissions.Steps: 1. Go to 'Project settings' > 'Permissions'. 2. Edit roles and access levels.

Advanced Searching with JQL.Definition: Jira Query Language (JQL) for advanced issue searching.
